intro: Mimulus mohavensis, commonly known as the Mohave monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its bright yellow-orange flowers and hairy, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a perennial herb that produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mimulus mohavensis plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar and habitat for various insects.
